intro: Zunilia sexpartita, commonly known as the six-parted zinnia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically range in color from yellow to orange and red. The plant has slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Zunilia sexpartita is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and it produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its bright colors and drought tolerance.
